El empezó desde muy joven en el negocio, a la edad de los 17 años, por lo que no termino su secundaria para dedicarse a esta labor, sin embargo sus aspiraciones era terminar su secundaria e ingresar a la universidad.
Su plan de inversión es para brindarle mantenimiento preventivo a su camión, herramienta de trabajo para lograr obtener sus ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia.

Antes de iniciar en este negocio él trabajaba como cobrador de buses, y sus padres le apoyaron para iniciar con este tipo de negocio para que pueda salir adelante.Su estado civil es acompañado y tiene un niño de cuatro años de edad.
texts.en:
Ricardo is a small business owner located in the municipality of San Rafael duel Sur, Managua, Nicaragua. His business consists of providing transportation services and the sale (by ambulatory means) of construction materials.

He started at an early age in his business. At 17 years old he did not finish his middle school to work in this field. Nevertheless, his ambitions were to finish middle school and enroll in the university. He will invest the loan in the preventative maintenance of his bus, a tool for this work, in order to financially support his family. 

Before he starts his business, he will work as a bus conductor. His parents helped him to start this type of business so that he can get ahead. 

Ricardo is married and he has a 4 year old son.

loans.use: to buy new tires for the preventative maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Habilhan

texts.en:
Habilhan is 61 years old and lives with his two children in a small house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His older son, Keldimurat, is 28 years old. He is married. His daugther, Almagul, is 21 years old.  

In 2009, Habilhan started the grocery trade with his daughter, who always supports his business.They are experienced with more than 6 years in the grocery retailing industry. Their monthly profit is approximately 600,0000  MNT. In 2012, he wants to make his grocery store larger. 

Habilhan is asking for a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more goods and furniture for his grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more goods and furniture for his grocery store.

loans.name: Damdinsuren

texts.en:
Damdinsuren is 47 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger in Tosontsengel south of Zavkhan province. His wife is a street food vendor, his older daughter is a college student, and his younger children are secondary school students. Damdinsuren started his mini-truck transportation service business in 2010 and his monthly profit ranges from 150,000 to 250,000 MNT. His business is seasonal and he is therefore planning taxi service to provide year-round income. 

Damdinsuren is requesting 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy a car for his taxi service. He is a humble and hardworking man. Damdinsuren says, ''my older daughter is college student so I have to prepare for my daughter tuition.''

loans.use: to buy a car to start a taxi service

loans.name: Las Manzanitas Group

texts.es:
Reciban un cordial saludo de sus hermanos peruanos; hoy les hablaré del grupo Las Manzanitas. Este es un grupo conformado por 9 socios que recién están iniciando su primer ciclo; pero entre ellos se conocen hace mucho tiempo porque sus negocios están dentro de la misma localidad. Todos ellos tienen grandes sueños y ganas de seguir creciendo tanto personalmente como en sus negocios.
Marleny, socia de este grupo es una joven madre soltera de 30 años que vive con sus 02 menores hijos, quienes son su único motivo para luchar cada día.
Ella se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, sándwiches, pollo broaster, etc. en un módulo ubicado en la esquina de una concurrida calle de su localidad; ella lleva con este negocio hace ya más tres años. Ella sólo vende sus productos por la tarde porque por las mañanas esta al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos.
Parte de su préstamo lo invertirá en acondicionar su módulo y la otra parte para comprar los insumos necesarios para preparar y vender sus productos, tales como: Aceite, platos descartables, mondadientes, envolturas especiales para sus sándwiches, etc.
Su sueño es poder acondicionar un local pequeño para ofrecer un lugar más cómodo donde sus clientes puedan saborear sus deliciosas meriendas; sobre todo las salchipapas que son las preferidas de sus comensales.
Marleny nos dice: ¡Gracias al equipo Edaprospo y a las personas de Kiva por el apoyo absoluto a las personas emprendedoras.
Marleny es la Primera de la izquierda, viste con una chompa color negra y polo cuello alto color rojo
texts.en:
A cordial welcome from your Peruvian brothers!  Today I will tell you about the group "Las Manzanitas."  It is a group made up of nine members who are just starting their first cycle.  But they have known each other for a long time because their businesses are in the same area.  They all have big dreams and the desire to continue growing personally as well as in their businesses.

Marleny is a member of the group and is a young single mother of 30 who lives with her two minor children, who are her only motivation to struggle every day.  She works selling french fries with hot dogs, sandwiches, broasted chicken, etc., in a place located in the corner of a popular street in her town.  She has had this business for more than three years.  She only sells products during the afternoon because in the mornings she takes care of her small children.  

She will invest part of her loan in improving her stall and the rest in purchasing needed ingredients to prepare and sell her products such as oil, disposable plates, toothpicks, special wrappers for her sandwiches, etc.

Her dream is to improve her little stall to offer a more comfortable place where her customers can enjoy their delicious dinners -- especially the french fries and hot dogs that are their favorites.

Marleny tells us: "Thanks to the Edaprospo team and the people of Kiva for their total support of entrepreneurial people."  Marleny is the first from the left, dressed in a black sweater and red turtleneck.

loans.use: to improve her stall and to buy oil, disposable plates, etc.

loans.name: Jagapar

texts.en:
Mr. Jagapar is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children, ages 20, 8 and 6, in a small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His older son is college student and the other children go to the secondary school. His wife is a hospital nurse. 

Mr. Jagapar owns two billiard tables in the local market of Bayan-Ulgii. His daily income is from 20,000 to 25,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). His monthly net profit is 520,000 MNT. He is very experienced at his work, which he has done since 2005.  

Mr. Jagapar is planning to expand his billiard service. He is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to purchase a new billiard table. Mr. Jagapar hopes to grow his business. He wants his own billiard club.

loans.use: To purchase a new billiard table.

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyunchimeg is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five children in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. Her husband is a herdsman, and her three children go to the secondary school. She moved to Tosontsengel with her family from the countryside in 2007. 

She started her own national shoe-making business in 2007. Today, Mrs. Oyunchimeg is well-experienced in making national shoes; local residents appreciate her as a hardworking woman. 

She is requesting a 2,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase raw materials for making shoes. Mrs. Ouynchimeg's goal is to increase her profit and to save the money for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Vitarte Group

texts.es: Hola a todos, desde Perú les presento al grupo” los ángeles de Vitarte” conformado  por 10 integrantes los cuales muchos de ellos se dedican  al comercio minorista para lograr un desarrollo económico  para sus familias, tal es a si una de sus integrantes la Sra. Sara de 48 años de edad casada y madre de 5 hijos, ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de granos de café que cosecha de su pequeño terreno agricola, también se dedica a la venta de miel de abeja, el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de educación de sus hijos. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de miel para su posterior venta. En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y mejorar la economía en su hogar y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Al igual que la Sra. Sara todos los integrantes se encuentran agradecidos por el préstamo brindado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido otorgado.
texts.en:
Hello to everyone from Peru. The group “Los Angeles de Vitarte” (The angels of Vitarte) is comprised of 10 members. Most members work in the retail trade to improve their families lifestlyle. 

One of the members, Sara, is 48 years old, married, and a mother to 5 children. She works daily to the sale of coffee beans that she harvests on her small plot of land. She also sells honey from bees which has allowed her to generate income to cover the costs of her children’s’ education. 

With the loan she will invest it in the purchase of honey to resell. In the future she would like to have her own store where she can sell products to improve the finances in her hometown and offer a better quality of life to her family. 

Similar to Sara, all of the members are grateful for the loan and for the confidence that has been entrusted to them.

loans.use: to buy honey from bees to resell to customers

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en: Mr. Byambasuren is 21 years old and lives with his parents and sister in a small house in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.  He is not married.  His father drives a truck, his mother is unemployed and his sister is a pharmacist.  He started a taxi service business in 2009.  His business is sustainable and has many regular customers, but Byambasuren’s monthly income does not usually meet his family's necessities.  He wants to expand his business.  He would like to buy a new car for his business.  The price of the car is 5,000,000 MNT.  He has prepaid 4,000,000 MNT for the car.  Now he is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to pay off the rest.  He is a calm and diligent man.

loans.use: To buy a car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Narangerel is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a ger (a Mongolian housing tent) in Arhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Munhbold, is 32 years old. He is running a business that sells firewood. Her older sons Baasansuren and Munhbold are aged 9 and 7. They are secondary school students.  Her younger daughter, Namuun, is 4 years old. She joined a kindergarten. 

Mrs. Narangereleg has been selling meat on a rental counter at a food market since 2003. Her business has a net profit 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) every month. She is experienced and a hardworking person.  

She is asking 3,500,000 MNT to buy a car for her business.

loans.use: To buy a car for her business.

loans.name: Ingrid

texts.es: Ingrid de 27 años de edad vive en la hermosa Cartagena de Indias, ciudad de estilo colonial ubicada en el centro del litoral caribe al extremo nororiental de Colombia. Allí tiene  una refresquería donde vende cervezas y poni malta principalmente; su idea de negocio nació hace 8 años, de observar que en un lote contiguo donde habitaba y propiedad de su madre, se reunían los vecinos con mucha camaradería, para comentar sobre la vida y lo que ocurría en su entorno, al son de la música que tenia su tío, a través de un equipo: “Pick up” de gran tamaño.  Ingrid con olfato de negocio le propuso a su madre asociarse con su tío, para hacer de ese lote una terraza refrescante. Empezaron vendiendo cervezas, poni malta, gaseosas e hicieron una pequeña pista donde bailar al aire libre; poco a poco este negocio se hizo mas popular, pero fueron presentándose grandes desafíos como el deterioro de la salud de su tío y su madre ya no atendió mas el negocio. Así fue como Ingrid lo retomó pero alineándolo solo a la venta de cervezas y refrescos por cajas, a pequeños negocios de su alrededor; su punto frio fue fortalecido por las referencias de su madre con el proveedor, las cuales trasladó a Ingrid y ella ha sabido conservarlas. Así fue como desde hace 4 años tiene crédito de estos proveedores, pero como su clientela ha crecido, requiere tener un mayor capital ya que sus ventas son buenas pero limitadas al crédito que tiene. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen cervezas y refrescos en general. Su meta es lograr convertir su negocio en un punto comercial frio reconocido por todos los negocios que están el sector donde está ubicada , para genera mas ingresos y un mayor bienestar para los suyos.
texts.en:
Ingrid, 27, lives in the beautiful city of Cartagena de Indias, a colonial-style city located in the middle of the Caribbean coastline at the far northeast of Colombia. There she has a beverage shop where she sells mainly beer and Pony Malta. Her idea for the business came eight years ago, upon noticing that on a lot next to where she lived which was owned by her mother, her neighbors would meet with a lot of camaraderie, to chat about life and what was happening around them, to the sound of music provided by her uncle, through his equipment: a large-sized pick up truck.

Ingrid, with her business sense, suggested that her mother work with her uncle to make this lot a refreshing terrace. They began selling beers, Pony Malta, and soft drinks, and they made a small open-air dance floor. Little by little, this business became more popular, but there were great challenges, like the decline of her uncle's health, and that her mother no longer attended to the business.

This is how Ingrid took it up, moving to selling only beer and soft drinks by the case to small businesses nearby. Her cooler was filled through her mother's references with the supplier, which passed to Ingrid, and she has been able to maintain them. That is how she has had credit with these suppliers four years, but as her customer-base has grown, she needs more capital since her sales are good but limited to the credit that she has. 

This is the reason she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a greater volume of beers and soft drinks in general. Her goal is to convert her business into a commercial cooler recognized by all the businesses in the area where she is located, to obtain more income and a better wellbeing for her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of beers and soft drinks in general

loans.name: Fé Y Alegría  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fe y Alegría está formado por 10 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, todas son amigas y conocidas que le dan un ambiente de amistan en cada reunión del grupo, pasan su tiempo en la reunión hablando de varios temas de su interés y como podrían mejorar algunos aspectos de sus vidas.  Son personas amables, gentiles, de un corazón muy cálido que aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Esta ciudad tiene una arquitectura moderna y lo colonial, es de clima frió y es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señorita. Ingrid, este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por sus hermanas, vive por la ciudadela Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca. Es soltera y vive con su madre quien labora como empleada privada, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señorita. Ingrid está estudiando en la universidad la carrera de Medicina, cursa el sexto año por lo que está muy emocionada ya que le falta poco para cumplir su meta, para ayudarse en la solvencia de sus estudios trabaja en la venta de cosméticos y ropa por catalogo actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años, vende su mercadería a sus compañera de estudio y conocidas. 

Su primer crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de oferta como perfumes, maquillajes y ropa para aumentar su mercadería.
 
Su meta es de culminar sus estudios y realizar una especialización en Endocrinología.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Fe y Alegria" is made up of 10 women and 1 man who live in different parts of the city of Cuenca.  They are all friends and acquaintances who exhibit a spirit of friendship in each group meeting.  They spend their time in the meeting talking about various subjects that interest them, and how they will be able to improve some aspects of their lives.  They are kind and gentle people with warm hearts, who still maintain their culture and the traditions of their towns.  This city has an architecture that is both modern and colonial.  The climate is cold, and it is the third most important city in the country.

One of the members of this group is Ingrid.  This is the first loan that she has taken with her communal bank.  She was invited to join the bank by her sisters.  She lives in the Uncovia neighborhood of the city of Cuenca.  She is single and lives with her mother, who works for a private company.  They don't have their own home, so they are renting.

Ingrid is studying for a degree in medicine.  She is in her 6th year of studies, and so she is very excited because she is very close to completing her degree.  To help cover her educational expenses, she works selling cosmetics and clothing through a catalog.  She has been doing this work for 3 years, selling her merchandise to her fellow students and acquaintances.

She will invest her first loan in the purchase of products to sell, such as: perfumes, makeup, and clothing.  This way she can increase her merchandise.

Her goal is to finish her degree and work as an endocrinologist.

loans.use: to buy perfume, makeup and clothing

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Kong is 32 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband runs a business selling sand. He earns about $3 daily. One of her children is employed in a garment factory as well. In order to improve her family’s finances, Kong is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase more sand to resell. This purchase will help her increase her daily income. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more sand to resell

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is 52 years old. She has two children who are adults. She has been a farmer for 20 years. She earns from it 3,000,000  Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. 

She has taken part in SEDA’s crediting program since 2009. The last loan cycle, she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy farm supplies to raise animals and grow vegetables for a living.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies to raise animals and grow vegetables for a living.

loans.name: Balcon Florido Group

texts.es:
Muy buenas Tardes esta vez conocerán a uno de los grupos más antiguos  “Balcón Florido” la cual está  conformado por 10 socios que pasan al 12 ciclo, la gran mayoría  vecinos de la zona, dicho grupo han demostrado responsabilidad y honestidad.
Teódulo de 40 años es casado y tiene 01 hija, su familia ha sido su mayor motivación para seguir mejorando cada día. Teódulo como la gran mayoría de sus compañeros se dedica a la elaboración de queso donde luego los ofrece en tiendas y mercados,  lleva trabajando de esta manera hace más de 15 años. Fruto de su esfuerzo es que ha cumplido unos de sus metas mejorar su vivienda y apoyar a su hija con sus estudios. Su mayor deseo es de seguir trabajando positivamente, pues esto le permitirá seguir apoyando a su hija con sus estudios. Solicito el crédito para la compra de  insumos como: sal, cuajo (pastillas para cuajar el queso) y moldes para la fabricación del queso. Se siente feliz a ver que otras personas lo ayuden en su progreso. Teódulo se encuentra en la parte posterior, es el segundo del lado derecho y viste una camisa blanca con rayas negras.
texts.en:
Good Afternoon!  At this time, we will meet one of the oldest communal banks, "Balcón Florido,” which is made up of 10 members who are in their 12th loan cycle.  Most of the members are neighbors from the area.  This group has demonstrated responsibility and honesty.

Teodulo, 40, is married and has a daughter.  His family has been his main motivation to continue to improve each day.  Teodulo, like most of his fellow group members, has a business making cheese that he offers to stores and markets.  He has been in this line of work for more than 15 years.  A fruit of his labors is that he has accomplished one of his goals: to make improvements to his house, and he has also supported his daughter in her education.  Teodulo's main desire is to continue working positively, as this will permit him to continue to support his daughter's education.  

Teodulo is requesting a loan to buy supplies, such as: salt, rennet (enzymes to curdle the cheese), and molds to make the cheese.  He feels happy to see that other people are helping him to make progress.  In the photo, Teodulo is at the back.  He is second from the right, wearing a white shirt with black stripes.

loans.use: to buy salt, rennet, and molds to make cheese

loans.name: Ivania

texts.es: La Sra. Ivania de 29 años de edad, es soltera, tiene tres hijos que estudian la educacion primaria, habita en el caserio Maria Cristina, es docente de educacion Primaria,  tiene mas de 6 años de ejercer esta labor,  con su trabajo ha sacado adelante su familia, es una persona amable, culta, responsable y muy querida por sus familiares y vecinos. Solicita su primer credito para realizar mejoras a su vivienda que actualmente necesita hacerle un anexo para darle mayor comodidad a sus hijos que estan en edad de crecimiento. Su mayor sueño es tener todas las condiciones en su hogar y que a sus hijos no les falte el pan de cada dia.
texts.en:
Ivania, 29, is single and has three children in elementary school. She lives in the village of Maria Cristina and has been an elementary school teacher for more than 6 years. Her job has enabled her to provide for her family. Ivania is friendly, educated, responsible, and cherished by her family and neighbors.

She is requesting her first loan to make improvements to her house, which requires an addition to make it more comfortable for her growing children. Her greatest dream is that her house be in good condition and that her children are provided for each day.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for an addition to her house.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 35-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer for seven years, and his main hardships are price fluctuations and inflation. 

Patrick also has challenges in transporting goods to the market, and he now intends to buy a motorcycle to ease the problem of transportation. He has a vision of buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help him expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport his good to the market.

loans.name: Buhtumurchudur

texts.en:
Buhtumurchudur, 37 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a small house in the Songinohairkhan district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife, Tsesenjaw, is 32 years old, while his daughter, Enhjin, is 10 years old and in school.

Buhtumurchudur started a grocery store in 2006 with his wife. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers and suppliers.  An honest and quiet-natured person, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy more inventory for his grocery store. Buhtumurchudur is planning on managing a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his grocery store.

loans.name: Al-Amran Group

texts.en: Mrs. Huda is a 36-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She has been a member of Al-Amran Group since its initial loan cycle. Her group is composed of women living in Taiz, Yemen, and maintaining friendly relations. She sells incense. She has been doing this for ten years and has plenty of experience. In the photo, she is sitting. Her new loan of 50,000 Yemeni rials will allow her to buy incense to be retailed.

loans.use: to buy incense for her business

loans.name: Jugdernamjil

texts.en:
Jugdernamjil, 34 years old, lives with her husband and son in a ger in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. Her husband, Javhlantugs, works as a codriver at a transportation service and operates a raw materials retailing business. Her son goes to school. She and her family are honest and hardworking.

Having graduated from a hairdresser course in 2004, Jugdernamjil started a hair salon business in 2005. She is now requesting a loan for 1,000,000 MNT to increase her working capital to purchase hair and beauty salon equipment.

loans.use: to increase her working capital to purchase hair and beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Al-Dhbia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-dhbia. It consists of seven ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. 

Ashwag is 37 years of age. (She is holding a cloth in the photo).  She is a married woman and lives in Sana`a, Yemen. Her business is a retail one; she sells perfumes, incense and clothes. 

She applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemen rial (YER) from AMB to buy more incense for her business. The profits generated will allow her to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more incense for her business.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en: Sivorn is 33 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a rice farmer who earns about $4 each day. Sivorn is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her rice cultivation go faster. In the future, she would like to run an additional business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor for tilling her farmland

loans.name: Furaha Chanika Group

texts.en:
Anastazia, a 30-year-old married mother of three children who go to school, has been selling charcoal for about two years now and is doing very well. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $80.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to be able to build a house. She will share this loan with her loan group "Furaha Chanika," which consists of 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Makuti  A Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her late 40s, is married with five children who go to school,  She has been running a "Mama Lishe" (food business) for about twenty years now. She is working hard and it shows; she works  from 6.00 am to 2.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 15th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to pay school fees, household expenses and she increased the missing items in her food stock (potatoes and coconuts).  She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She wants a loan to finish building her business room and pay her children's school fees.  Her dream is to one day to be able to open a food shop.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Makuti A” which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to finish building her business room and paying school fees.

loans.name: Rukwa Group

texts.en:
Martha, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who go to school,  She has been selling new fridges since 1998.  She works  from 7:30 am to 8:00 pm daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her 9th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to paint her house, pay household expenses, buy a microwave and DVDs.  She has repaid all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to buy DVDs and a microwave to resell.  Her dream is to one day be able to buy a taxi and bajaji (motorized rickshaw).

She will share this loan with her loan group “Rukwa” which has a total of 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy DVDs and a microwave.

loans.name: Samiah's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Wahda and consists of five women who are all hardworking. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. They took a loan of 250,000 YER.

Amh is 31 years old, a single woman. Her educational background is a bachelor's degree.  She has tried to work hard. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living. Due to the high cost of goods, she has requested a loan of 50,000 YER to buy bedroom furnishings like blankets, cushions, etc. In the future, she hopes to have a big house.

loans.use: to buy bedroom furnishings like blankets, cushions, etc. for her house.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, who previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more clothes, accessories, and other saleable items needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Emma would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more clothes, accessories and other saleable items. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Emma hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for restocking inventory needed in her business.

loans.name: Savart

texts.en: Savart is 35 years old. She is married and resides with four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in weaving and buying cattle to resell for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Savart is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more cattle to resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she will earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар молодой человек,женат отец двоих малышей.Он уже седьмой год работает в лепёшечном цеху, заготовщиком лепёшек(национальный хлеб). Его жена сейчас на декретном отпуске и занимается воспитанием детей. Анвар живёт в жилом доме, который требует ремонта, но из-за ограниченного дохода Анвар никак не может начать ремонт.Поэтому узнав от друзей о банковских кредитах он решил обратится в нашу организацию. На полученный кредит хочет побелить дом, и покрасить окна и двери.
texts.en:
Anvar is a young man who is married with two small children. He has been working in a flatbread shop as a flatbread preparer for six years now. His wife is currently on maternity leave and is taking care of the children.
Anvar lives in a house that needs to be repaired, but due to his limited income, Anvar has not been able to start the repairs. So when his friends told him about the loans, he decided to request one from our organization. He plans to spend the loan on whitewashing his house and painting his windows and doors.

loans.use: to buy building paint

loans.name: Battsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Battsetseg is 35 years old and lives with her husband, N. Bayar-Erdene, and three children in a ger (Mongolian housing tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her children go to the secondary school, and her husband works in a construction company. 

She started her beauty salon business in 2011. Her business is located in the center market in Uvurhangai. Her business seems to be sustainable because she has gained a number of regular customers. She is a good-natured woman who says, "I want to expand my business, [my] beauty shop." She needs 1,200,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to purchase beauty salon equipment.

loans.use: To purchase beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. 

She has been running the business of buying motorbikes to resell for more than ten years, earning approximately $5 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Mary is requesting a loan of $800 to raise capital in her business to purchase more motorbikes to resell. This money will help her expand her business and make more profit to support the family.

 In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to raise capital in her business to purchase more motorbikes to resell.

loans.name: Baatarhuu

texts.en:
Mr. Baatarhuu is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger (traditional Mongolian felt housing) in Arhangai province. His wife helps his business, his son Nyamjargal and daughter Byambanaran are secondary school students, and his younger daughter, Yanjinlham, is going to kindergarten.  

Baatarhuu started his wooden furniture production business in 2005. How his monthly profit is 400,000 MNT and monthly sales income is 1,000,000 MNT. His business is sustainable and has many regular customers. He is a humble and hardworking man.  He dreams of owning a wood factory.

 He is requesting 800,000 MNT to buy raw materials such as wood and timber for his business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wood and timber for his business.

loans.name: Mram Group

texts.en:
This group is called Mram and consists of seven ladies who live in Sana'a, Yemen.

Samah is a 34-year-old woman who is the mother of six children, three of whom are still in school. She has been running a sewing business for two years. Her business is doing well. Her customer base has been growing over the course of time. She is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. The importance of this loan is that it will give her the opportunity to buy a fridge for her home.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her home.

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng is 42 years old. She is widowed and resides with two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling bananas for more than four years, earning approximately $20 per day. One of her children is an artist who can earn about $10 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Eng is requesting a loan of $1,000 to raise capital to purchase more bananas to resell. This money will help her expand her business. In the future, she would like to purchase a store in the market to sell the bananas and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to resell

loans.name: Batsuh

texts.en:
Mrs. Batsuh is 59 years old and lives with her three daughters in an apartment in Bayangol district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Batgerel, is 27 years old. She works for a private company. Her next oldest daughter, Enhbat, is 26 years old; she studies in Singapore. Her youngest daughter, Battsengel, is a college student, and 20 years old. 

Mrs. Batsuh is a female head of a household. She contacted food trade and shoes trade businesses, Dornogovi province. She moved to Ulaanbaatar city with her family from Dornogovi province in 2009. In 2010, she started a shoes trade business on a rental counter. Her business is successful. 

She is an open-minded and hardworking person. She needs 2,800,000 MNT to purchase more products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Chum Puo

texts.en: Chum Puo is 21 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been working in a restaurant for more than four years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) runs a phone shop. He earns about $25 per day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Chum Puo is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more phones to sell. This money will help her husband expand his business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase more phones to sell

loans.name: Terng

texts.en: Terng is 50 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling bananas for more than seven years, earning approximately $10 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $4 daily. Four of her children are employed. They earn about $16 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Terng is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase clothes to resell. By doing so, she would have one more business and earn more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to purchase a store to sell bananas in the market and help her youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. In addition, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 60, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her children, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Lilia operates a junk shop. Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and, while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, paper and other materials. They sell these to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries like factories and others of the like. Aside from this, Lilia also raises pigs in her compound. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan in her current revolving fund used to buy trash from collectors. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Lilia hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
This is Florida, 34, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. Her husband is Alex, an employee, and she is a mother to her four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Florida operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy kitchen wares from wholesalers and sell them per item at a profit. Her products are kitchen tables, water jugs, plate holders and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many products that she offers. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Florida dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for repair and maintenance of her room for rent.

loans.name: Sheraton Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, age 28, is married and has three children, one of whom goes to school.  She has been selling clothes for about two years now to her special customers. She is really working hard.  She works from 1pm to 4pm daily and she is able to make good monthly profits.

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan to buy more stock of clothes to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house and expand her business.

She will share this loan with her loan Group Sheraton, which consists of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
This is Lorena, 29, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lorena operates a market stall. She sells fruits and vegetable products in the community market. She buys quantities of fruits and vegetables and sells them per kilo. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 9,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of fruits and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
	
Lorena dreams of having her own house and having a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for vegetables and fruits needed in her business.

loans.name: Orange Group

texts.en:
Walter, age 50, is married with six children, three of whom go to school.He has had two businesses: a Bodaboda (motorcycle) business) and a Genge-shop(selling charcoal, fruits, vegetable, water, soap etc) for about five years now. He is really doing great. He works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be his fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a new loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Walter's dream is to one day be able to sell charcoal at the wholesale price.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Orange", which consists of 13 members who will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, a widowed mother of four children.  She previously received a 25,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase greater quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures and paying for her children's education. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan for her to buy more groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Josefina hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she dreams of  being able to provide her family with a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie veuve de 48ans a 05 enfants. Deux sont sur les bancs d’école. C’est depuis 2002 qu’elle a commencé son activité de vente des assiettes en plastiques dans une boutique. Elle sollicite son second crédit pour acheter des assiettes en plastiques pour bien répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité, acheter en gros pour pouvoir vendre à un prix considérable aux clients et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en:
Marie is a 48-year-old widow, with five children.  Two of her children attend school.

She has been selling plastic plates, in a shop, since 2002.

She is requesting a second loan for the purchase of plastic plates in order to adequately meet her customers' needs.

She wants to reinvest in the activity.  She would also like to buy in bulk so that she can sell at a good price, and see her family thrive.

loans.use: to buy plastic plates.

loans.name: Cristia

texts.en:
This is Cristia, 62. She is a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, self-employed and a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Cristia operates an LPG business. What she basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, then sells them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Cristia hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams to give a good future to her family through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of LPG tanks.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
This is Amelita, 57, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Doroteo and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Amelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Amelita hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and other products for her store

loans.name: Kulagwa Group

texts.en:
Parizadi, who was born 1960, is married with two children who go to school. She has had been selling chips, fish and women's clothes (kanga) for about 20 years now. She works from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more potatoes and fish and pay school fees and household expenses. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She hopes for a new loan to increase her stock of potatoes, fish and clothes to resell to many people. Her dream is to one day be able to change her house to be in a good vision and provide her children a quality education.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kulagwa", which consists of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her stock of potatoes, fish and clothes.

loans.name: Ma.luisa

texts.en: Ma.Luisa believes that" Success is the fruit of Sacrifices". She is 44 years old, married and has four school-age children. She and her husband agreed to continue sending their children to school so that they will earn a degree and become professionals someday.  Despite the hardships of living, they have the determination to survive as they continue to work hard and strive harder. To generate income, they put up a bakeshop  in their community and they help each other in managing it. They planned to improve the business and prepare more recipes to sell but due to inadequate capital, she is asking for an additional of P50,000 to buy flour, sugar, oils, milk, plastics and trays needed in preparing and making the recipes. She believes that their business will grow and becomes profitable as they continue to manage and make improvements for it.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oils, milk, plastics and trays needed in the bakery

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Tuy lives in a small thatched house with her spouse and two single children from Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is now 53 years old and is in the business of farming rice where she can yield a suitable profit. However, it is barely enough to cover her daily expenses due to the high cost of commodities. Tuy’s husband is the main income provider of the family. He works in the construction field, providing construction service to people around and across the province.

Tuy would like to improve her family business and make it more viable for the family. But due to inadequate capital, Tuy decided to take out a loan in the sums of 600,000 KHR to purchase chemical fertilizers to put in her soil and pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice. This loan will make her business become more profitable, and she hopes to obtain a good harvest in this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizers to put in her soil and pay for labor costs incurred in transplanting rice.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 32 years old and has two children. They live happily in a rural community where they can plant and harvest rice and vegetables for sale. 

While doing the household chores, Myrna finds time to manage her variety store. She has been operating the business for almost five years and usually earns a profit of PHP 10,000 a month, which she uses for daily consumption and allowances of her children in school. 

She aimed to increase her product offerings to satisfy her customers' demand. But because of insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, biscuits, junk foods, candies, noodles, eggs, meat, and vegetables for sale. 

She believes that this loan will help a lot to improve the business and she hopes she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, biscuits, junk foods, candies, noodles, eggs, meat, and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en: Despite the hardship of living, Marivic and her husband aimed to improve their status of living to educate their children and give them a bright future. She is 42 years old and has four school-age children. She is engaged in the hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, they need to increase their income to cover their necessities and support the education of their children. To increase her income, Marivic planned to raise more pigs to sell but due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional of P40,000 to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. She mentioned that this loan will help her to improve the business and hopes that she will make the business grow and become a viable source of income in the future.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 36ans, Mr Kossi est marié à une revendeuse et ils ont 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 10ans et le dernier 03ans. Pour bien répondre aux besoins de la famille il s’est lancé dans la vente des produits de beauté dans une boutique. Pour renforcer son stock de marchandises il sollicite l’aide de WAGES par ce troisième prêt pour acheter des marchandises (déodorant, parfums et savons). Avec les profits, il prévoit avoir une grande boutique pour vendre en gros, avoir d’autres boutiques dans les coins de la ville de Lomé et envoyer ses enfants pour les études en Europe.
texts.en:
Kossi is 36 years old, and he is married to a reseller with whom he has three children.  Two of his children go to school.  His oldest child is 10, the youngest is 3.

In order to adequately meet his family's needs, Kossi has started to sell cosmetic products in a shop.

In order to boost his inventory, he is requesting assistance from WAGES and is taking a third loan, which will be used to buy such goods as deodorants, perfumes and soaps.

With his profits, Kossi is planning to have a larger wholesale shop, to open other shops in various neighborhoods of Lomé, and to send his children to Europe, for their studies.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en:
Chhit is 44 years old and married to a humble villager who works in the same type of business, farming, as her. They don’t have any children but they wish one very soon. Chhit cultivates and harvests rice, vegetables, and other seasonal crops according to each season. She has been in this business for the past 10 years and earns a decent income to cover her daily costs.

Chhit is requesting a loan for 700,000 KHR, which she will use to hire laborers to transplant the rice and to purchase sacks of fertilizers for her crop care. She wants to expand her business in the future and hopes to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to hire laborers to transplant the rice and to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Al-Suadh Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Suadh and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Afrah is 39 years old. She is a housewife and has a house. She applied for a loan of 50,000 Yemeni rials from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank to buy construction supplies like cement, etc., for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies like cement, etc., for her house

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
This is Dominga.   She previously received a 19,000 PHP loan that she used to pay for raw materials and supplies needed in salted-egg production. Her earnings were a big help in meeting her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy eggs, trays, and other materials and ingredients needed in making salted eggs. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily, personal and business needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Dominga dreams of expanding her business, and she hopes to support her family through her hard work.. She also aspires to draw more customers in the future. Every week she faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.
 
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies needed in producing salted eggs.

loans.name: Mt Usambara Group

texts.en:
Daudi, who is in his early 50s, is married with six children, three of whom are adults and three of whom still go to school. He has been running a food shop for about two years now. He works from 6 am to 9 pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice and different kind of soaps and he has paid back his loan successfully. He hopes for a new loan to buy iron sheets to build a food shop room. His dream is to build a new good house, buy a farm and start a new chicken business.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mt Usambara", which consists of 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets to build a room for his food store

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Kang, 38, is in a direct-selling business. She collects fish from local farmers in her community and resells them in a small market.  She has been in this type of business for almost 5 years, earning in the neighborhood of 8,000 KHR per day.  Kang’s challenge in the business is that she sometimes cannot sell all her fish during the day, and those fish become rotten. Kang wants to overcome this challenge and increase her selling productivity by going through her commune selling her fish house to house. This will enable her to prevent a large loss. But Kang needs a vehicle to work out this plan. As a result, she is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used to transport her fish to sell door to door. Someday, with good profits from the business, she will provide a higher education to her three children.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle, which will be used to transport her fish for selling.

loans.name: Wega Group

texts.en:
Nelly, who is in her early 20's, is married.  She has been a food vendor for about three years now. She works from 5am to 11pm daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to add food stock and buy a fridge, and she paid household expenses and has paid back all her loans successfully.  She hopes for a loan to start a grocery business (buying water, sodas and beers). Her dream is to one day be able to own a big grocery.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Wega" which has 13 members.The members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy water, sodas and beer.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 40, resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Junie, a driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 pesos worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Pheach

texts.en:
Pheach is a resident living from Reussey Keo district, a suburb of Phnom Penh. He is now 45 years old and married to his wife, who helps him generate income for their family with her grocery store. Together, they have six children.  Three of them are employed in a garment factory to help their parents financially; the younger three attend school and are still in need of daily allowances. Pheach is a professional teacher at a state school, and he can earn a decent salary from the government.

With the loan of 1,500 USD, Pheach would like to purchase more stocks of merchandise for his wife's store, such as shampoos, powders, snacks, sweets, spices, canned items, noodle, beverages, personal beauty products, home use products, and other household items. Through this purchase, they hope that they will be able to satisfy more customers and thereby raise more income.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of merchandise for his wife's store.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé âgée de 44ans est mère de 02enfants qui vont à l’école. Ils sont âgés de 19 et 17ans. Depuis  2007, elle vend dans une boutique de la boisson locale « SODABI » à toutes personnes. Pour renforcer son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un second prêt pour acheter de la marchandise. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et comme perspectives d’avenir elle voudrait acheter en quantité considérables pour vendre, tirer un maximum de profit et bien entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Ayélé is 44 years old and the mother of two children, ages 19 and 17, who both attend school.

Since 2007, she has been selling a local drink, Sodabi, in a shop.  Her customers come from all walks of life.

In order to boost her inventory and buy more merchandise, she is requesting a second loan from WAGES. 

She wants to reinvest in her business.  In the future, she would like to buy in very large quantities in order to sell at a better price, to make more profits, and to take good care of her family.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
This is Daniel, 52, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Analyn and a father to their children.   He and his wife manage their  household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Daniel maintains a tricycle business. He owned and drives a tricycle unit (a motorcycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. He starts working early in the morning and continues until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until the wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are neighbors and the local community.   He earns a minimum of PHP 300 in his transportation business every day.

To help him continue operations, he is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000. He will be using the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Daniel hopes to buy another tricycle and hopes to support his children's schooling up to college level. He faithfully meets up every week with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work. It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en:
This is Rosana, who is 40 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Placido and a mother to her children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosana operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She profits by buying supplies at wholesale and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rosana hopes to grow her business and dreams of givng her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Dukuzanye Group

texts.fr:
Thomas fait partie du groupe Dukuzanye et habite  Bujumbura. Il a  55 ans et est mariée à  Olive, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 8 enfants âgés de  12 à  20 ans,tous étudient.

Il fait le commerce de manioc sec et de la farine de manioc depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de manioc sec; une partie sera revendue comme telle,une autre sera transformée en farine avant la vente, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Thomas is a member of the Dukuzanye group and lives in Bujumbura.  He is 55 years old and married to Olive, a seller.  Thomas and Olive have eight children, ages 12 to 20, who all attend school.

Thomas has been selling dried cassava and cassava flour for the past 20 years.

This is his seventh loan with Turame.  With his loan from Kiva, he will boost his capital and buy a large a quantity of dried cassava, part of which will be sold as such, while the rest will be processed into flour before being sold.  This loan will ultimately help him to make more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of dried cassava (part of which will be sold as such, while the rest will be processed into flour before being sold).

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lila es conviviente, tiene 38 años de edad y tiene 5 hijos en edad escolar, Lila  es integrante  de la alcancía comunal  “El Esfuerzo es Grande”, grupo conformado por 9 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Lila  trabaja vendiendo comida, marcianos desde hace 4  años a su vez vende sanguches y salchipapas en las noches en un carrito sanguchero, Lila inicia este negocio con la idea de ayudar con los gastos de la casa ya que el sueldo de su esposo no era suficiente,Lila trabajo muy duro,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha  logrado darles a sus hijos educación, ha construido su casa  y a su vez le ha brindado una mejor calidad de vida a  su familia. Con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (papa, pollo, etc). Lila  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agradece a Edaprospo y kiva por el prestamo.
texts.en:
Lila, 38, has a partner and five school-aged children. She is a member of the communal bank "El Esfuerzo es Grande" (Effort is Great), a group made up of nine members who work in various trade activities. Lila has worked selling food and popsicles for four years. At night she also sells sandwiches and salchipapas (fried potatoes with hotdogs) from a sandwich cart. Lila started this business with the idea of helping with home expenses since her husband's salary wasn't enough.

Lila works very hard. Thanks to her effort and dedication she has been able to give her children an education, she has built her house, and at the same time, she has given her family a better quality of life. With the goal of continuing to work, she is applying for a new loan to buy ingredients (potatoes, chicken, etc.) Lila will meet her goals with a lot of work and effort. She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients (potatoes, chicken, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
This is Annabelle, who is 36 years old and a resident of Silang, Cavite Philippines. She is married to Danny, a security guard, and a mother to their children. She and her husband manage their household. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Annabelle oversees operations of their tricycle transportation business. They own one tricycle, a motorcyle plus sidecar, that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. The tricycle driver then remits a bounty (daily quota) each day to her. In her business the regular customers are the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 every day.

 To help continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy spare parts and accessories and also for the maintenance of their motorcycle. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Annabelle dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her tricycle vehicle.

loans.name: Basima

texts.en: Basima is 40 years old and a mother of five. She has a number of goats that she uses to get milk and make some dairy products for sale. She has applied for this loan to increase the number of goats she has to increase her productivity.

loans.use: to increase the number of goats she has.

loans.name: Twibesheho Group

texts.fr:
Rose fait partie du groupe Twibesheho et habite à Gitega. Elle a 37 ans et est mariée à  Joseph, un commerçant et cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants dont 5 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce  de banane  et de vin de banane depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes certaines seront revendus comme telles et d’autres seront transformées en vin de banane à vendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Rose is a member of the Twibesheho group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 37 years old and married to Joseph, who is involved in farming and business.  Rose and Joseph have seven children, five of whom are in school.

Rose has been selling bananas and banana wine for the past ten years.

This is her 12th loan with Turame.  With her loan from Kiva, she will boost her capital and buy large quantities of bananas, some of which will be resold as such, while others will be processed into banana wine for resale.  This loan will ultimately help Rose to make more money.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of bananas to be sold as such or processed into banana wine.

loans.name: Pucacruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pucacruz  está formado por 8 socias quienes son todas amigas y de una misma comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, parroquia que tiene varios lugares para disfrutar, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo. Las socias son personas amables, cálidas y  algunas se dedican a laborar en el comercio, pero su trabajo en común es la cría de animales y la agricultura, también mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos lo cual es un orgullo.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Dolores, este es el primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su último hijo de 15 años de edad está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, una de sus hijas hace 7 años ha emprendido el viaje pero desde que salió de su casa nunca más tuvo noticias de ella y aun espera que ese día llegue. Su esposo es agricultor, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña María Dolores se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y al arduo trabajo del campo, ella siembra papas, verduras y hortalizas las que vende en la ciudad, también cría cuyes, borregos, cerdos y gallinas a los que los vende en su comunidad.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos de una mejor raza.

Su meta es terminar su casa ya que aun le hacen falta algunas puertas y ventanas
texts.en:
The "Pucacruz" communal bank is made up of eight members who are all friends from the same community, which is in the parish of Valle in Cuenca. It's a parish that has many places to enjoy; its architecture is a mixture of modern and historical. The members are kind, warm people; some of them earn a living working in markets, but the work that they have in common is raising animals and agriculture. They are also proud to maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

One of the members of this group is María Dolores. This is the first loan that she has taken out in the communal bank, which she was invited to join by a friend. She is 48 years old, married, and has four children from her marriage. Two of them are married and live on their own, and her youngest son, who is 15 years old, is studying at a school in the city. Her other daughter set out on a trip seven years ago, but they haven't had any news from her since she left the house; they are still hoping that that day will arrive. María Dolores's husband is a farmer, and they own the house they live in.

María Dolores spends her time doing household chores and working in the fields. She grows potatoes and vegetables that she sells in the city. She also raises guinea pigs, lambs, pigs, and hens, which she sells in her community.

She will invest her loan in the purchase of better breeds of hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.
 
Her goal is to finish her house since it still lacks some of the doors and windows.

loans.use: to buy hens, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Lach is a 47-year-old married woman who has been raising piglets as her main source of income for ages, followed by a rice farming business. 

When the piglets mature, she usually sells them to butchers who come into her village. For additional income, Lach owns a general store, selling a mixture of various things in front of her house. 

Another main income is from her spouse, who is operating a firewood-trading business. He typically generates about 7.20 USD per day. Lach has five children: the oldest one is already married; two of them have jobs while the other two are still attending school. She needs to pay daily allowances for her two school-aged children.

As of now, Lach would like to borrow 1,500 USD to purchase two buffaloes for farming tasks as well as for pulling the firewood trailer. 

She hopes to improve her family-owned businesses and yield more revenue to ensure a good living standard for her family.

loans.use: to purchase two buffaloes for farming as well as for pulling a firewood trailer.
