Armando has four children, two of whom are still studying in college. Due to the high costs of commodities, school fees and transportation, he needs to earn a higher income to cover their needs and support the education of his two young children. 

For this reason, Armando plans to sell more commercial and NFA rice to increase his income. He is asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stock of the said products to sell in the market.

He hopes that this financial assistance will enable him to improve his business as he continues to work and strive harder to succeed.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of commercial and NFA rice to sell.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
This is Leonora, She previously received a PHP 41,000 loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her rug-making business. Her earnings were a big help for their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials for her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Leonora hopes to increase production and dreams of being able to give everyone in her family a good life through all of her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials and supplies for her rug-making business.

loans.name: Ossila

texts.fr: Jeune dame de 26ans, Ossila n’est pas encore mariée et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Pour subvenir à ses moindres besoins, elle a commencé par vendre depuis 2009 des tissu-coupons de façon ambulante et sur étalage. Elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Avec les profits réalisés, elle désire ouvrir une boutique et vendre en plus des tissus coupons, des articles scolaires.
texts.en: A young woman of 26 years, Ossila is not yet married and doesn't have any children in her care. To provide for her smaller needs, she has sold fabric swatches both as a traveling saleswoman and in a stall since 2009. She is asking for a first loan from WAGES in order to stock up on merchandise. With the profits she makes, she wants to open a shop and sell, in addition to fabric swatches, school supplies.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
This is Marivic.  She previously received a PHP 45,000 loan that she used to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan to buy additional stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result for better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily and business needs. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Marivic dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give a good future to her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of LPG gas.

loans.name: Piece Group

texts.en:
Editha, who is in her early 30s, is married with two school-going children. She has been a tailor and seller of fish, juice and water for eight years now. She works from 9 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit of $7 per day.

This will be Editha's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy fabrics with which to make more clothes to resell. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

Editha is asking for a loan so she can buy stock of fish and fabrics for making more clothes. Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business and provide her children with a quality education.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Piece," which totals 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and fabrics for making more clothes.

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали родился 1964 году в Гиссарском районе. Он женат. У него трое сыновей. Муродали имеет среднее образование. Он на протяжении пяти лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Муродали арендует торговую точку, где занимается торговлей обуви. Он привозит товар из Душанбе. В торговле ему помогают сыновья. Муродали просит кредит для приобретения автомашины, чтобы привозит товар на своей автомашине.
texts.en:
Murodali was born in 1964 in the Gissar region. He is married, and has three children. Murodali has secondary education. 

For a period of five years, he has been engaged in trade at the market. Murodali rents a stall, where he sells shoes. He brings goods from Dushanbe. His sons help him with the trade. 

Murodali requests a loan for the purchase of a vehicle, in order to transport the goods in his car.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle to transport shoes for selling at the market

loans.name: Mbogo Group

texts.en:
Fortunatas, who is in her early 40s, is single with three children who go to school. For six years she has been running two businesses: poultry (meat and eggs) and vegetables. She is doing well. She works from 6 am to 12 am daily and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

She is requesting her eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start running a new business of chicken eggs and she has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for the new loan to buy more stock of chicken feed. Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business widely.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mbogo", which consists of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicken feed.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña  Juana de 35 años de edad, soltera, habita en Barrio el Recreo, Jornalera, tiene dos hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian su educacion primaria, Ella  es una persona trabajadora, muy activa y animada, trabaja en el INTA desde hace 8 años, de donde se beneficia para el mantenimiento de su familia y esta muy agradecida con su trabajao que tambien le ha permitido construir poco a poco su casa propia.  Su proposito con este credito es comprar una enciclopedia pagar sus hijos tengan una buena Educacion y se preparen para el futuro.  Su mayor deseo en la vida es que sus hijos sean personas preparadas y puedan valerse por sí solos, que tengan lo comodidad y sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Juana is 35 years old, single, and lives in Barrio el Recreo.	She is a day laborer with 2 minor children of primary school age. Juana is a hard-working person, very active and animated, who has been employed at the INTA for some 8 years. The work has helped her to maintain her family and she is very grateful for her job. Also, it has permitted her, little by little, to construct her own house.

Her proposition for this loan is to purchase an encyclopedia to help her children obtain a good education and prepare for the future. Her greatest desire in life is for her children to become well-prepared people who can take care of themselves, enjoy comforts, and become good people.

loans.use: to buy an encyclopedia for her children's educational investigations.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: Чамшед родился 1975 году в районе Хуросон. Он живет с женой. У него четверо. Его дети маленькие. Жена Чамшеда преподавательница начальных классов. Сам Чамшед занимается торговлей на рынке. У него смешанный ассортимент товара. Торговлей Чамшед занимается восемь лет. Он просит кредит для приобретения необходимых хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en:
Jamshed was born in 1975 in the Khuroson region. He lives with his wife. He has four children, they are young. Jamshed's wife is a primary school teacher. Jamshed himself works with trade at the market. He sells general merchandise, and has been engaged in trade for eight years. 

Jamshed requests a loan for the purchase of necessary household goods.

loans.use: to purchase household goods for selling at the market

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun is a 40-year-old man who is originally from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. He is married with three children, one of whom is already settled in a marriage and lives independently. Being a responsible father, Chhun pays his full devotion to rice farming business, from which he can generate a decent income for his household. The main challenge in his business is insects, which reduce the yields. Despite this hardship, Chhun and his wife agreed to educate their school-aged children up to college. They hope to provide them with a higher education as their legacy to pass on them.

Due to the need for capital to make progress in his current business, Chhun decided to gain access to financial assistances through HKL. He will use the loan of 400 USD to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his crop care. He believes that the loan will help him go far in the business and produce a satisfactory harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his crop care.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en: Kunthy is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been working in garment factory for more than two years, earning approximately $3 daily. In addition, she sells cosmetics at home. Her husband is a rice farmer. In addition, he runs a public transportation service (motor taxi). He earns about $4 each day. Kunthy is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase timbers and zinc to rebuild her house. By doing so, she would enlarge her house and provide enough space for her family. In the future, she would like to run a poultry farm and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase timber and zinc to rebuild her house

loans.name: Thuon

texts.en: Thuon is 38 years old and a resident living in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is married with four grow-up children, one of whom is currently working in Phnom Penh to help the family earn more income. Thuon has been planting and harvesting on her own farmland for almost 22 years with constant support from her helpful spouse. Together, they are able to yield approximately 2.00 USD per day each. Thuon and her spouse would like to improve their living conditions and provide basic necessities to their children. That is why Thuon is requesting a loan through HKL and Kiva to purchase a fishing boat and fishing materials to start a new business. Her husband will be the operator of this fishing business. Thuon has been a three-time client of HKL. She commented that her previous loans were very helpful for both her business and living.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and fishing materials to start a new business.

loans.name: Maileen Rose

texts.en:
This is Maileen Rose, who is 26 years old and a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is still single, and she manages her household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for everyday expenses.

Maileen Rose operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maileen Rose hopes to grow her business and dreams of a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products for her business.

loans.name: Emomali

texts.ru:
Эмомали проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. 
Эмомали имеет высшее педагогическое образование. Он более восьми лет работает учителем. Эмомали совмещает работу продавца. Он занимается торговлей канцелярских товаров. Эмомали просит кредит для покупки книжек для школьников, тетрадей, и других необходимых школьных принадлежностей.
texts.en:
Emomali lives in the Khuroson region. He is 35 years old, and married. He has two children. His wife is a housewife. Emomali has a degree in teaching. He has worked as a teacher for more than eight years. Emomali combines this with working as a salesman. He works with trade of stationary. 

Emomali requests a loan for the purchase of schoolbooks, notebooks and other necessary school supplies.

loans.use: to purchase schoolbooks, notebooks and other necessary school supplies for selling at the market

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru:
Хуршед проживает в районе Дж. Руми. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. Живет у родителей. Хуршед предоставляет услугу, он занимается организацией свадебных мероприятий. Этим видом деятельности занимается шесть лет. Хуршед также хочет заняться животноводством. На сегодняшний день в доме у родителей Хуршеда имеются несколько голов овец. 
Хуршед просит кредит для закупа телят, коз и овец, чтобы начать свою деятельность.
texts.en:
Khurshed lives in the J. Rumy region. He is 26 years old, and married. He lives at his parents' house. 

Khurshed provides a service, he works with organizing weddings. He has been engaged in this type of activity for six years. Khurshed would also like to work with livestock breeding. Currently, Khurshed has several heads of sheep at the home of his parents. 

Khurshed requests a loan for the purchase of calves, goats and sheep, in order to start his business.

loans.use: to purchase calves, goats and sheep

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Em is from Oddar Meanchey province, Cambodia. She happily lives there with her spouse and three single children. Currently, only her last-born child is still attending to school. The other two children help her to manage their rice farm. Em owns just a small size land to grow rice, which does not result in yields annually and this encourages her to pursue another retail business to stabilize her income and support their household living needs. Em’s husband provides well-digging services to local area, particularly for hand pump wells, and he has a good reputation because of his professional skills. As there is an order from his customer at the moment, Em’s husband will lead his team to handle a good project. However, he has insufficient capital for the purchase of hand pump tools and spares for his project. To make it possible, Em would like to take out a loan in the sum of 1,000 USD from HKL and Kiva. Through this purchase, Em’s husband will be able to supply tools for the maintenance of his work. They hope that they are able to have good revenue after the well-digging project is completed.

loans.use: to purchase hand pump tools and spare parts

loans.name: Bopha

texts.en: Bopha is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband runs a taxi service (motor taxi). He earns about $5 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Bopha is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase more groceries to sell. By doing so, she will increase her grocery inventory and earn more income for her family. In the future, she would like to use the profit to expand her store and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to resell

loans.name: Esnarda

texts.en:
This is Esnarda, a widow with three children.  She previously received a PHP 42,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 42,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and the education of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Esnarda dreams of being able to grow her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products for her business.

loans.name: Loik

texts.ru: Лоик уже 25 лет предоставляет услугу на своем грузовом автомобиле. Он развозит товары по городом и района Таджикистана. Лоик проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 60 лет. У него трое детей. Лоик просит кредит для приобретения баллонов и ремонта грузового автомобиля.
texts.en:
Loik has been providing a service with his truck for 25 years already. He brings goods around the cities and regions of Tajikistan. 

Loik lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 60 years old. He has three children. 

Loik requests a loan for the purchase cylinders and for repairing his truck.

loans.use: to purchase cylinders and to repair his truck

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 32 years old and married to her husband, a taxi driver, and they have four children, who are currently attending school.

Sam makes a living in a hog-raising business. She has been fattening piglets for eight years already.  As her pigs mature, she usually sells the fattened hogs to local traders or a butcher in her neighborhood, earning a profit of 6,000 KHR per day to cover expenses. 

This loan is to buy a motorcycle to satisfy their household needs. 

She has been a client of HKL for four times already. It provided her with a suitable interest charge, as well as other low-income family financial services. 

Her dreams are to continue progressing with her business and to have good health.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for household needs.

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich, age 32, is a garment worker in the Ang Snoul district generating a monthly salary to support her living. She is married to a man working in the same type of business and has given birth to two young kids. She has been in this occupation since 2009, earning around a hundred per month.

Due to the lack of a vehicle for commuting to their workplaces, Pich is now asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a motorcycle which will help in their daily transportation needs. When they own this motorcycle, they can avoid paying for any taxi services and increase their savings for future emergencies of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle which will help with their daily transportation needs.

loans.name: Sophan

texts.en: Sophan is 40 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and other agricultural crops for more than 20 years, earning approximately $6 daily. Sophan is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a computer for her children to use in their studies. This would be very helpful in her children’s education. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase a computer for her children to use in their studies.

loans.name: Rut

texts.en: Rut is 41 years old. She is married and resides with eight children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in a shop for more than a year, earning approximately $3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 each day. Three of her children are employed. They earn about $9 per day. Rut is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase zinc to fix her house's roof. In addition, a part of this money will be used to pay for a tilling service. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelors degrees.

loans.use: To purchase zinc to fix her house's roof

loans.name: Mom

texts.en: Mom is 37 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been running a grocery store for more than four years while earning approximately $15 daily. Her husband is a boat maker who earns about $7 per day. In order to improve her family’s living conditions, Mom is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase timbers for her husband to make more boats to sell. This money will help her husband improve his business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase timbers for her husband to make more boats to sell

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosa forma parte del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias hace 2 años, ha vivido toda su vida en la comunidad de Chican que pertenece al cantón de Paute, este cantón tiene un clima templado, sus tierras son muy fértiles en donde se da una gran cantidad de frutas, también son propicias para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores, su gente es amable y muy gentil, trabajan a diario en diferentes actividades para sacar  adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Rosa es una mujer que le dedica el mayor tiempo posible a su hogar, tiene 28 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero y la casa en la que viven es de propia. 

Ella le ayuda a su esposo a trabajar en la agricultura y vende sus cosechas en su comunidad, también cría gallinas, cuyes y ganado. Algunas veces cuando le llaman labora en el arreglo de casas o lava ropa ajena.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para incrementar sus animales. 

Su meta es ir creciendo en la cría de animales para ampliar mas este negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa has been a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Solidarias" for 2 years and has lived all her life in the town of Chican in Paute canton. The canton has a temperate climate, and its lands, on which much fruit is cultivated, are very fertile. Conditions are also excellent for growing the most beautiful flowers. The people are friendly and very kind. They work daily at a variety of jobs to provide for their families while maintaining the culture and traditions of their communtities. 

Rosa, 28, spends most of her time working in her home. She is married and from her marriage has two children, ages 8 and 6, who are students at the small public school. Her husband is a day laborer, and they own the house in which they live. She helps her husband with the farmwork and sells the harvest in her community. She also raises chickens, guinea pigs, and cattle. Sometimes, she cleans houses or does laundry for others. This loan will be used to buy chickens to increase her stock. Her goal is to expand her business raising animals.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Aberlardo Rene

texts.es: El Joven Abelardo de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, habita en casa de sus padres, sus cosas personales las ha adquieridos por medio de su trabajo, es muy responsable y dedicado, Labora en el Inta desde hace 3 años, desempeñando el cargo de Jornalero de donde obtienes sus ingresos para el apoyo familiar y sus gastos personales. Solicita este credito para comprar un Solar que le venden y a futuro construir una casa.  Su mayor sueño en la vida es llegar a construir su propia vivienda, casarce y tener hijos.
texts.en:
Abelardo, 29, is single and does not have children. He lives in his parents' house and has bought personal items with wages he has earned. He is very responsible and dedicated. He has been working in Inta for 3 years as a day laborer. He helps support his family and pays his personal expenses with the income from this work. 

Abelardo is requesting this loan to buy a plot of land on which he will build a house. His great dream is to construct his own home, get married, and have children.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Rustamkhon

texts.ru:
Рустамхон житель района Хамадони. Ему 38 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Рустамхон предоставляет услугу. Он дает в аренду столы и стулья для проведения мероприятий и свадеб. Также Рустамхон дает в аренду посуду. Этим видом деятельности он занимается три года. 
Рустамхон просит кредит для приобретения машины, чтобы облегчит свою работу. Он будет рад вашей помощи.
texts.en:
Rustamkhon lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 38 years old and married with four children.
Rustamkhon rents tables and chairs for events and weddings. Rustamkhon also rents out dishes. He's been in this business for three years.
Rustamkhon has requested a loan to buy a car to help him in his business. He appreciates your help.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo is 44 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a real estate broker. He earns about $3 per day. Two of her children are construction workers who earn about $9 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Sambo is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase cattle to breed and sell. By doing so, she would earn extra income for her family. In the future, she would like to build a new house and help her children earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to breed and sell

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech is 28 years old. He is married and resides in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He is a traditional musician who earns about $4 per day. His wife is involved in breeding pigs. She earns about $2 per day. In order to improve his family’s finances, Pech is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase fodder and ducks to breed. This money will help him generate more income for his family. In the future, he would like to purchase pigs to breed and build a new house.

loans.use: To purchase fodder and ducks to breed

loans.name: Sinoun

texts.en: Sinoun is 32 years old. She is single and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed in the temple preservation unit for more than ten years, earning approximately $3 per day. In order to improve her living conditions, Sinoun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase sculptures to sell. By doing so, she would earn more income to pay for her living expenses. In the future, she would like to rent a store to sell sculptures and build a new house, if possible.

loans.use: To purchase sculptures to sell

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is 28 years old and the mother of a small kid (shown in the photo). She lives with her family in Ang Snoul district, Kandal Province. To make a living, Hay works on the sewing staff of a local garment factory while her husband is involved in a construction business as his main income. Hay has been doing her job for more than two years. 

Hay wishes to have a vehicle for household use as well as for commuting to work. Because of the lack of a vehicle, she and her husband have great expenses for transportation services from day to day which decreases their earnings. As a result, Hay is taking out a loan in the amount of $800 US to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy their daily needs. She hopes that she will be able to save more money for future emergencies of the family as well as for her child’s education. In the future, Hay wants to own a store to supply construction materials and tools in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy their daily needs.

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señorita. María esta en el noveno crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, es oriunda del cantón de Paute pero por motivos de trabajo vive hace dos años en la ciudad de Cuenca, su cantón es conocido por su clima templado, sus tierras son muy fértiles en donde se da una gran cantidad de frutas, también son propicias para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores, su gente es amable y muy gentil, trabajan a diario en diferentes actividades para sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Ella tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.

La Señorita María labora como empleada domestica puertas a dentro en la ciudad de Cuenca, actividad que la desempeña hace 2 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados. En su casa que está en el cantón Paute cría cerdos, pollos y cuyes los cuales están bajo el cuidado de su mamá.
 
Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y materiales de construcción para hacer un nuevo galpón de pollos.
 
Su mayor sueño es poder viajara hacia los Estados Unidos.
texts.en:
Srta. María is on her ninth loan in the Mujeres Solidarias Communal Bank. She is a native of Paute canton but due to work has lived the past two years in the city of Cuenca. Her canton is known for its moderate climate and its very fertile land, which produces a great many fruits. The land is also conducive to growing the most beautiful flowers and its people are friendly and very gracious. They work daily in different business to move their families ahead, while still maintaining traditional village culture.

She is 31 years old, single and has no children.

María is employed as an indoor maid in the city of Cuenca, a job she has had for two years and she works from Monday to Saturday. At her home in Paute canton she raises pigs, chickens and guinea pigs, which are being cared for by her mother. 

She will invest her loan in the purchase of chickens and construction materials to build a new chicken shed.

Her greatest dream is to be able to travel to the United States.

loans.use: to buy chickens and construction materials.

loans.name: Jenga Group

texts.en:
Yohana, who is in his late 20s, is single. He has been running a shoe business (matching guy) for 1 1/2 years now. He is doing great. He works from 2 p.m. to 8 p.m. daily and he is able to make a fair monthly profit.

Yohana requested a fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to stock the missing items in his business and pay for household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for this loan to buy more stock of shoes to resell.

The borrower will share this loan with his loan group "Jenga" which totals 16 members. They will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes to resell.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en: Pov is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a gardener for more than six years, earning approximately $4 each day. Her brother is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. In order to improve her family’s finances, Pov is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase piglets to breed and sell when they gain weight. In addition, a part of this money will be used to build a piggery. This money will help her earn more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and fix some parts of her house. Moreover, she hopes to get a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed and sell when they gain weight

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive por la comunidad de Chican, que pertenece al cantón de Paute, este cantón tiene un clima templado, sus tierras son muy fértiles en donde se da una gran cantidad de frutas, también son propicias para el cultivo de las más hermosas flores, su gente es muy amable y gentil, trabajan a diario en diferentes actividades para sacar adelante a sus familias, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María es una mujer muy joven con apenas 25 años, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado y la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Ella para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar se dedica a la agricultura y comercialización de sus productos, también es negociante de hortalizas, verduras y granos tiernos actividad que la realiza hace 9 años en un mercado del sector. En casa a más de estar pendiente de toda su familia también cría pollos, cerdos, ganado y gallinas las que vende en su comunidad. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas, verduras y granos tiernos para así crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María is on her sixth loan with the communal bank "Mujeres Solidarias." She lives in the community of Chican, which is part of the canton of Paute. This canton has a temperate climate, and its very fertile soils produce large quantities of fruit; they are also favorable for the cultivation of the most beautiful flowers. The people are very kind and courteous. They work every day at different activities to support their families, while maintaining the culture and traditions of their people.

María is a very young woman, barely 25 years old. She is married, and she and her husband have two children, ages seven and two. Her oldest child is a student in a little school in their town. Her husband works as a private-sector employee and they own the house they live in.

To help her husband with household expenses, María works in agriculture and sells what she grows. She has also been buying vegetables and legumes and selling them in a local market for nine years. At home, on top of being available for her family, she also raises chickens, pigs, and cattle to sell in her community.

She will invest her new loan in the purchase of vegetables and legumes so she can grow her business.

Her goal is to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is 37 years old. She is married and resides with seven children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $7 per day. One of her children is a security guard who earns about $2 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s living condition, Lim is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a taxi service. By doing so, her son would generate more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to run a grocery store at home and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she plans to fix some parts of her present house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her son to run a taxi service.

loans.name: Concepcion Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. Concepcion , tiene la edad de 42 años, es casada, tiene 2 hijos,habita en la comarca el recreo, se caracteriza por ser una persona honrada,amigable,responsable; trabaja en  El Inta como Jornalera,de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia;Ella con sacrificio a sacado adelante a su familia,y a mejorado sus conocimientos profecionales,  esta solicitando este credito para comprarle una Computadora a sus hijos, el cual les servira para sus estudios ya que sera de gran ayuda para el aprendizaje y tendran un mejor desempeño en su calidad de educacion;Su mayor deseo es que sus hijos se preparen y sean alguien importante para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Sra. Concepcion is 42 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the region of El Recreo. She is known as an honest, friendly and responsible person. She works in El Inta where she earns her living as a day laborer in order to support her family. 

She has sacrificed to move her family ahead so they can improve their professional knowledge. She is requesting this loan in order to buy a computer for her children, which will help them in their studies because it will be a great learning aid and will have a positive impact on the quality of their education. Her greatest dream is that her children be prepared and that they become people of importance in society.

loans.use: to buy a computer for her children's education.

loans.name: Tola

texts.en:
Tola is 21 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. 

She has been selling groceries for more than a year, earning approximately $2 per day. In addition, she grows rice. Her husband is employed in APSARA preservation unit. He earns about $3 each day. 

Tola is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for tilling her farmland.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say, aged 33, is a farmer residing in Kampot province. She owns and operates a two-hectare plot of farmland along with her husband. Together, they are able to make a profit of 12,000 KHR each day through this type of business. 

In the rainy season, they spend most full-day time working at the rice field. Also, they hire a few workers for the maintenance of the rice field as there is much work to complete on time. With the profit from farming activities, they pay for their daily sustenance and allowances for their three school-aged children.

As of now, she is taking out a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to pay for labor costs. This loan will be a sufficient fund for them to enable their farm work. Say hopes that she can have a fruitful harvest in this coming season. 

Say wishes to give a constant support in her children’s education because she wants them to have a bright future.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Ana Katrina

texts.en:
This is Ana Katrina, 26, a resident of Manila, Philippines. Her husband, Alexander, is a call center agent. She is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Ana Katrina has a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy perfumes and jewelry and then sells them for a profit. Her regular customers are neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 3,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more jewelry and perfumes to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  
	
Ana Katrina hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a married mother of one child and she doesn’t go to school.  She has no additional family members.  

She has a shop selling cosmetics for different skin types and also weaves. She has been in this business for the last two years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics like braids, weaves, and oils.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda.  

 She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked cosmetics shop and also buying a plot of land. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics like braids, weaves, and oils.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a single mother of two children, both in school.  She has no additional family members.  

She has a food stall at the market and sells all types of foodstuffs.  She sells to all categories of people on retail and works seven days out of every week. She has been in business for the last 10 years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, baskets of Irish potatoes, onions, and banana clusters.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.   

She aspires to see her business grow so that she opens up other stalls in the market.   She resides in a rented house, and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school and food.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs, like Irish potatoes, onions, and banana clusters.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is a single mother of six children, and all of her children go to school.  She has no additional family members.  

She has a food stall at the market and sells all types of foodstuffs on a retail basis. She works seven days out of every week. She has been in  this business for the past six years. 

She has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes, baskets of Irish potatoes, onions, banana clusters, and sweet bananas.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation.   

She aspires to see her business grow big, so that she opens up other stalls in the market and also installs piped water and electricity at her home.   She resides in her own house, where the family now has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs like tomatoes, Irish potatoes, bananas, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is married to a businesswoman. The couple was blessed with two children who currently go to school. He and his wife work hard in order to make a living.

Jonathan is engaged in the agricultural business, particularly raising hogs. Aside from hog-raising, he also invests his time in raising rice crops. Jonathan's aim is to increase his profit to be able to let his two children finish their studies and be able to improve their way of living.

Jonathan would like to apply for a loan amounting to PHP 20,000, allowing him to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines to make his pigs healthier upon reaching their optimum growth. He hopes to get this amount of loan in order to have continuous business growth.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his raised hogs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old and a widow, with one child.  According to her, it's been 18 years since her husband passed away from cancer of the lungs. After that long period of pains and sorrow, she is still able to stand firm and live her life with full of hopes and the desire to succeed.

By this time, her child is on her third year of college. As a single mother, Zenaida needs to works hard to obtain greater income for the bright future of her only child.

Zenaida has operated her livestock business and general store for three years.  Profits gained from her businesses goes immediately to  household expenses and the allowance and tuition fees of her child.  So she struggles with a shortage of capital.

With regards to her situation, Zenaida is asking for a loan amount of PHP 15,000. This amount will be used to buy feeds and vaccines and ensure the proper growth of her pigs. 

She's hoping that through this loan, she will be able to improve her livestock and general store and have a stable source of income and obtain greater profits that will serve her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene la edad de 50 años, habitante de la zona # 2, es Comerciente, su principal actividad es Comprar y Vender Ropa Americana, Zapato Nuevos y cosmeticos, entre otros productos diversificados que le encarguen sus clientes siempre que este en el ramo de su negocio; tiene mas de 5 años de experiencia en el desarrollo de  su pequeño negocio, y hasta el momento esta motivada a seguir adelante con ello, pues es su principal fuente de ingregos.  Doña Maribel ha ido poco a pocos con esfuerzo propio y creditos creciendo en su negocio, anteriormente solicito un credito a Kiva el cual cancelo en tiempo y forma y agradeces a Kiva, pues gracias a esto pudo satisfacer la demanda de su clientela en entregarle la mercaderia solicitada asi Como Ropa y Zapatos, ella quiere continuar trabajando con creditos ya que es una manera de salir adelante, por lo que solicita este credito para invertirlo nuevamente en compra de productos para el negocio ya que ahora su clientela es mas, por lo que cuenta con un numero de clientes numerosos que demandan sus productos.  
Su meta es continuar creciendo en su negocio y generar mayor utilidad de modo que esto le permita mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maribel is a 50 year old resident of zone #2.  She is a business woman who's main business is to purchase and sell american clothes, shoes, and cosmetics among a variety of other products that are sought after by her customers whenever they are in her store.  She has more than five years of experience in developing her small business and to this day is motivated to keep moving forward as it is her main source of income.  

Little by little, Maribel has been growing her business through her own efforts and with loans.  She previously took a loan with Kiva which she paid on time and is grateful to Kiva because thanks she was able to satisfy the demands of her customers by delivering merchandise like clothes and shoes.  She wants to continue working with loans because it is a way to move her business forward.  She will invest this loan in more products for her business now that she has a larger and more demanding customer base.  

Her goal is to continue growing her business and thus generate higher profits which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase American clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for her business.

loans.name: Tob

texts.en:
Tob is a 26-year-old married woman who lives in Kampot province with her spouse and two young kids. She is a proud farmer who cultivates rice on about a one hectare and a half of farmland, generating approximately 6,000 KHR each day. She has been in this business, along with her supportive husband, for more than 10 years. This couple has two dependent children who are currently attending a local school. 

At the moment, Tob has hired construction laborers to get her house constructed, but she has insufficient money to purchase construction supplies such as cement, brick, and sand. With the help of the loan, Tob hopes to have a suitable house for her family where they can live happily and be sufficiently protected from the weather. Tob promises to pay her loan back punctually so that she can have another loan to support her business later.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies such as cement, brick, and sand

loans.name: Ebelio

texts.es: El Sr. Ebelio tiene 38 años y un hijo de la edad de seis años se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa y yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Abapo,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el Sr. Ebelio va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maíz y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, el Sr. Ebelio enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajador se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ebelio is 38 years old and has one six-year-old son. He works in agriculture, growing a variety of vegetables as well as potatoes, cassava, and corn on his plot of land located in the community of Abapo. 

This loan is Ebelio's first sequence within the institution. He is going to use this loan to plant corn and do everything that preparing the land entails. His reason for requesting this loan is to obtain resources for the planting and to be able to subsist. Ebelio is facing challenges in his business, like inclement weather that many times ruins the plantings. He will use the benefits to improve the quality of life of his customers and his family, since he is responsible for all the household expenses. 

Ebelio is a responsible and hard-working person. He feels grateful to the institution for the support it offers.

loans.use: to plant corn and do everything that preparing the land entails.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon is a humble farmer who resides in the Reussey Keo district, a suburb of Phnom Penh. He has been farming rice as his sole source of income for almost 14 years. As it is tiring work, Huon alone will not be able to get his farm work done on time during the rainy season. Consequently, he has some children and an accommodating wife, who always helps in maintaining the business. With their effort and determination, Huon hopes to experience a better standard of living someday. Houn is now 39 years old and has four children: three single children and a married one.

At this moment, Huon needs farm supplies to apply on his rice crops on time in order to keep them in good conditions. That is why he is requesting a loan in the sum of 600,000 KHR to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. With a portion of the loan, he will pay for labor costs. Hopefully, this loan will help him earn a higher income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and also pay for labor costs

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
This is Cecilia, who previously received a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her inventory. Her additional earnings have been a big help in the education of her children and the family's personal, household and business costs.

Cecilia is requesting another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional materials and products needed in her decoration business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial assistance with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Cecilia dreams of having a good life, with God at the center of their family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nely Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Nely  casada con 3 hijos que encuentran en edad escolar,  dedica al  comercio de chatarras y material para reciclar,  ella tiene su puesto de acopio que se encuentran la zona  16 de Julio  de la ciudad de El Alto, la Sra. Nely es cliente antigua de la institución , la Sra. va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material para reciclar por mayor, ella compra botellas de plástico, fierros y  papel, su  razón para solicitar este préstamo es que  quiere ya comprar por mayor para poder vender a las distintas instituciones que requieren este material para reciclar, la Sra. Nely enfrenta retos en su negocio que son que no es estable ya que es según la temporada  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando material, su deseo es tener un negocio estable y rentable y de esta manera genera más ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nely is married with three children who are of school age.  She makes a living selling scrap metal and material for recycling.  She has her collection place in the in “16 de Julio” zone of the city of El Alto.  

Nely is a former client of the institution.  She is going to use this loan to buy material for wholesale recycling.  She buys plastic bottles, pieces of metal and paper.  Her reason for applying for this loan is that she wants to buy wholesale in order to be able to sell to various institutions that require this material for recycling.  Nely faces challenges in her business such as that it isn’t stable since it depends on the season.  She is going to use the profits to continue buying material.  Her wish is to have a stable and profitable business and in this way generate more income and therefore improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy material for wholesale recycling.
